meanings.definition: Deprive of an endowment or endowments.
meanings.sent1: The charity disendows the university of its financial support.
meanings.sent2: The court order disendows the organization of its assets.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun disendows the garden of its magical protection.
meanings.sent4: The storm disendows the tree of its vibrant leaves.
meanings.sent5: The evil sorcerer disendows the hero of his special powers.

meanings.definition: To take away an endowment or endowments from.
meanings.sent1: The government disendows the museum of its historical artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The new policy disendows the foundation of its financial stability.
meanings.sent3: The prankster disendows his friend of the surprise gift.
meanings.sent4: The harsh reality disendows the dreamer of his illusions.
meanings.sent5: The thief disendows the mansion of its valuable paintings.
